revised_title: Effects of Randomness on the Stability of Two-Dimensional Surface Wavetrains
tldr: The authors study the stability of two-dimensional surface wavetrains with a simplified nonlinear spectral transport equation for narrowband Gaussian random surface wavetrains. They examine the stability of an initially homogeneous wave spectrum to small oblique wave perturbations and find that instability can exist for random deep water waves under certain conditions. The amplification rate associated with the instability diminishes as the correlation length scale of the random wave field decreases.
